New Records: For the first time in European Championship history, all four teams in a group are on equal points after two rounds.
Key Match Events: Youri Tielemans scored a goal after 73 seconds.
Kevin De Bruyne scored a late goal to secure Belgium's 2-0 win.
Romelu Lukaku had a goal ruled out for offside by VAR.
Koen Casteels made a crucial save from Radu Dragusin's header.
Dennis Man missed a clear chance for Romania, shooting straight at Casteels.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium manager Domenico Tedesco expressed satisfaction with the result and noted Romania left more space than Slovakia.
Romania coach Edward Iordanescu emphasized the need for solidarity and unity as they are still first in the group.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in an astonishing atmosphere in Cologne.
Romania and Belgium have the advantage with a plus-one goal difference in the group.
